Chaim Grade's works covered in section 1 include various titles such as "Yo", "Musarnikes", "Dojrois", "Oyf di Hurves", "Pleitim", "Farvoksene Vegn", "Der Mames Tzavoe", "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern", "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner", "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah", "Hurbin", and "Vilna" with 5 major parts. Chaim Grade's works in section 1 include titles such as "Yo", "Musarnikes", "Dojrois", "Oyf di Hurves", "Pleitim", "Farvoksene Vegn", "Der Mames Tzavoe", "Shayn fun Farloshene Shtern", "Mayn Krig Mit Hersh Rassayner", "Yerushalaim shel Maylah, Yerushalaim shel Matah", "Hurbin", and "Vilna". Other works by Grade mentioned are "Vaulted Gates", "Talmudic Scholars in Lithuania", "On My Way to You", "The Old House", "From Beneath the Ground", "Yury Goresha", "The Bachelors", "Wrestling with the Angel", "Chaim Nachman Bialik", "H. Leivik, The Poet of Suffering and Fate", "H. Leivik in my Life and my Works", and "Itzik Manger, the Poet of Irony and Play". Itzik Manger is highlighted as a poet of beauty and play, along with three Yiddish classics by Mendele, I.L. Peretz, and Sholem-Alaychem. Anski is described as a champion of enlightenment, a revolutionary, and a penitent. The author discusses problems faced by Yiddish writers and in Yiddish literature, their path in Yiddish literature, encounters with Soviet Yiddish writers, and three dramatic poems they have written. Itzik Manger's works include various topics such as Young Vilna, The Return to Zion, The Sabbath in Yiddish Literature, Mussarists and Lithuanian Yeshivas, Rabbi Israel Baal Shem Tov, Rabbi Israel Salanter, The Talmudic Scholar in Yiddish Literature, and more. Dr. Samuel Ravidovitch's lectures and essays cover topics such as the Jewish life worldwide, Yiddish writers in Soviet Russia, Rabbi Jehudah Ibn Samuel Dr. Kaufman, Song of Songs, Saffed and Mount Miron, the greening of Israel, Vilna's uniqueness, Histadruth, and Yiddish life in Vilna during World War II. Chaim Grade's works include topics such as Jewish life in Vilna before World War II, Hebrew literature in Israel, survivors of concentration camps, controversies among rabbis in Vilna, American Yiddish poets, and other works by Grade.
